## Implementation Complete

I've created the full Todo PWA application with data persistence built into every layer. Here's what was built:

### Files Created

| File | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| `index.html` | Semantic HTML5 structure with PWA meta tags, ARIA labels, and accessible form |
| `styles.css` | Mobile-first responsive CSS with 44px touch targets, focus indicators, edit mode styles |
| `app.js` | SAM architecture with Model, Actions, and State layers — all with Local Storage persistence |

### Architecture: SAM Pattern

```
User Event → Action → Model.save() → renderState() → DOM
```

- **Model** (`app.js:56-199`) — Holds authoritative state, validates business rules, persists to Local Storage on every mutation
- **Actions** (`app.js:207-250`) — Thin layer that delegates to model and triggers render
- **State/Render** (`app.js:258-325`) — Computes derived data (filtered todos, counts) and updates DOM

### Data Persistence (Acceptance Criteria)

| # | Criterion | How It's Met |
|---|-----------|-------------|
| 1 | Todos persist in Local Storage | `model.save()` writes `JSON.stringify(todos)` to `localStorage['todos']` on every change |
| 2 | Filter persists across reloads | `currentFilter` saved to `localStorage['currentFilter']` and loaded on init |
| 3 | Optimistic write on every change | Every model method (`addTodo`, `toggleTodo`, `deleteTodo`, `editTodo`, `setFilter`, `clearCompleted`) calls `this.save()` immediately |
| 4 | Page reload restores exact state | `init()` → `model.load()` → `renderState()` restores full state from Local Storage |
| 5 | No backend server required | Pure client-side vanilla JS + Local Storage, zero network dependencies |

### Key Design Decisions

- **Graceful corruption handling** — `model.load()` validates data shape and falls back to empty state on corrupt JSON
- **Immutable updates** — All state changes create new arrays/objects, never mutate in place
- **Event delegation** — Single listeners on `todoListEl` handle all todo item interactions efficiently
- **Double-click edit** with Enter to save, Escape to cancel, blur to auto-save

## "Display Todo List" — Implementation Summary

The feature was already implemented across all three SAM layers. I identified and fixed one defensive gap:

### Change Made

**`app.js:69-73` — Sort guarantee on load**

Added `.sort((a, b) => (b.createdAt || 0) - (a.createdAt || 0))` after filtering loaded todos. DOMContentLoaded

    → model.load()          // Reads localStorage, validates, sorts by createdAt desc
    → renderState()

      → renderTodoList(todos)      // Builds <li> elements: checkbox + title + delete btn
      → renderEmptyState()         // Shows "No todos yet..." if list is empty
```

On every subsequent action (add/toggle/delete/edit):

actions.X() → model.X() → model.save() → renderState() → DOM updates
```
